note: To allow for comparisons between countries and over time, the metrics are [age-standardized](#dod:age_standardized). Statin use was estimated from purchases by stores and hospitals and, in special cases like the United Kingdom, data on prescriptions for patients. All deaths in a country may not have been registered with a [cause of death](#dod:underlying-cause-of-death).
title: Statin use vs death rate from cardiovascular diseases
subtitle: The use of [statins](#dod:statins) in the population, measured in [Defined Daily Doses](#dod:defined-daily-doses) per 1,000 people. This is compared to the reported annual death rate from [cardiovascular diseases](#dod:cvd) per 100,000 people, based on the [underlying cause](#dod:underlying-cause-of-death) listed on death certificates.
sourceDesc: Guadamuz, Shooshtari and Qato (2022), WHO GHO
